title.rendered: Back at OpenAI, Sam Altman fired the board of directors

content.rendered:
Sam Altman has returned to the position of Chief Executive Officer (CEO) of OpenAI, the inventor of ChatGPT, after a few days of drama. A day later, he dismissed the board of directors of the company.

Earlier on Friday, the board of directors removed Sam from the post of CEO. Later, Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella said that Sam would join his company.

Meanwhile, more than seven hundred employees of OpenAI told the board of directors in an open letter that if Sam is not returned, they will also quit their jobs. Soon after, Sam was brought back as CEO by OpenAI.

Upon his return as CEO, Sam fired all but one of OpenAI’s board of directors. Just survive Adam D’Angelo. He is the CEO of Quora. Now X-Salesforce Co-CEO Brett Taille and former US Treasury Secretary and Harvard University President Larry Summers can join the board.

In addition, Greg Brockman, co-founder of OpenAI, can join the board. Greg announced his resignation as president of OpenAI last Friday, shortly after Sam lost his job.
